Package imagingbook.lib.ij

Class CustomOverlay<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ij.gui.Overlay
      • imagingbook.lib.ij.CustomOverlay<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of elements allowed to be added to this overlay
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<ij.gui.Roi>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CornerOverlay, HoughLineOverlay, SiftOverlay
    @Deprecated
public abstract class CustomOverlay<T>
extends ij.gui.Overlay
    Deprecated.
    Defines a subclass of ImageJ's Overlay class that accepts elements of a specific type CustomOverlay. This (abstract) class cannot be instantiated directly but is supposed to be used as the superclass for specific overlay types, e.g., for displaying corners, SIFT markers etc. (e.g., see SiftOverlay). In the simplest case, the concrete subclass just needs to implement the method makeRoi(Object), which is only concerned with geometry. Stroke width and color are handled uniformly by this class (CustomOverlay). The coordinates of added ShapeRoi instances are automatically shifted by a half-pixel distance (0.5, 0.5) to display integer points at the associated pixel centers.
    Note: ImageJ draws all ROI types except ShapeRoi with a half-pixel offset. This class redefines the methods Overlay.add(Roi) to perform the half-pixel shift.
    TODO: Merge this with ShapeOverlayAdapter and ColoredStroke (which is simpler).
    Note: This is experimental code - do NOT rely on it!
    Version:
    2020/10/04

      • makeRoi

        public abstract ij.gui.Roi makeRoi​(T item)
        Deprecated.
        This method, which must be implemented by any subclass of CustomOverlay, defines how an instance of type CustomOverlay is converted to an Roi object. Called by addItem(Object).
        Parameters:
        item - an instance of type CustomOverlay to be added to the overlay
        Returns:
        the resulting Roi object

      • strokeColor

        public void strokeColor​(java.awt.Color strokeColor)
        Deprecated.
        Sets the stroke color for all items subsequently added to this overlay. The stroke color can be changed any time between insertions. Uncommonly named (like a directive) to avoid confusion with the existing Overlay.setStrokeColor(Color) method, which modifies all elements currently contained in the overlay.
        Parameters:
        strokeColor - the new stroke color to be used

      • getStrokeColor

        public java.awt.Color getStrokeColor()
        Deprecated.
        Returns the overlay's current stroke color. Useful for modifying the value temporarily and then reinstating the previous value.
        Returns:
        as described

Uncommonly named (like a directive) to avoid confusion with the existing Overlay.setStrokeWidth(Double) method, which modifies all elements currently contained in the overlay.
        Parameters:
        strokeWidth - the new stroke width to be used

      • addRoi

        public void addRoi​(ij.gui.Roi roi)
        Deprecated.
        Adds an ImageJ Roi instance to this overlay. A half-pixel shift is applied if the passed ROI is of type ShapeRoi. Should be used instead of Overlay.add(Roi).
        Parameters:
        roi - the ROI to be added

      • addRoi

        public void addRoi​(ij.gui.Roi roi,
                   boolean shiftHalfPixel)
        Deprecated.
        Adds an ImageJ Roi instance to this overlay. Optionally, a half-pixel shift is applied if the passed ROI is not drawn with a half-pixel shift by ImageJ. Does not apply the overlay's current stroke width and color settings. This method should be used instead of Overlay.add(Roi).
        Parameters:
        roi - the ROI to be added
        shiftHalfPixel - if set true a half-pixel shift is added to each coordinate

      • addItem

        public void addItem​(T item)
        Deprecated.
        Adds a single item of type CustomOverlay to this overlay. Applies the overlay's current stroke width and color settings.
        Parameters:
        item - an instance of type CustomOverlay

      • addItems

        public void addItems​(java.util.List<T> items)
        Deprecated.
        Convenience method. Adds all items of type CustomOverlay in the supplied list to this overlay, using the same graphics (color, stroke width) settings.
        Parameters:
        items - a list of instances of type CustomOverlay
